definition: to push out the old and bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)

sentences.english: It is time to try something new!
sentences.chinese: 现在是推陈出新的时候了。

sentences.english: Fashion designers make every effort to show variety and create something new to attract attention.
sentences.chinese: 时装设计师要不停地推陈出新，力求花样百出。

sentences.english: With the development of times, international practice will abandon the old and bring forth the new.
sentences.chinese: 随着时代的发展，国际惯例也是不断推陈出新的。

sentences.english: Finally, the author emphasizes two aspects: Lattimore's understanding on Inner Asia and his innovations in research methods of Chinese frontier history.
sentences.chinese: 二是拉铁摩尔在中国边疆历史研究方法上的推陈出新。

sentences.english: The kids would get bored with monotony, if there is no change in toys, once in a while.
sentences.chinese: 如果玩具千篇一律，不推陈出新，那么孩子会玩腻的。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, new menu are constantly developed to cater to the clientele.
sentences.chinese: 为答谢广大忠诚顾客，美食品种更在不断地推陈出新。

definition: abreast of modern developments/to keep up with the times/progressive/timely
innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
to discard the old and introduce the new (idiom); to innovate
to innovate/innovation
not follow the beaten track/have an original style
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
to perfect sth that is already outstanding (idiom); constantly improving
iteration (math.)/repeated substitution
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
unfailing/never-ending
daily renewal, monthly change (idiom)/every day sees new developments/rapid progress
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
reform and renewal/generational change
incorporating diverse things (idiom)/eclectic/all-embracing
to blaze a new trail (idiom); to display originality
to make new advances/to move forwards
